channel.title: My TiddlyWiki
channel.description: a reusable non-linear personal web notebook

item.title: TiddlyWiki266Changes
item.description:
The following is a summary of changes to internal core objects and methods in TiddlyWiki v2.6.6 (alpha 1):

commitSystemSettings

Updates to the SystemSettings tiddler (i.e., when you change a persistent option checkbox or text input) will now trigger autosave handling if chkAutoSave is enabled.
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/72

backstage.cloak.style.height, backstage.preparePanel, findDocHeight

The "backstage cloak" (shading applied to the document when the backstage is displayed) now matches document height instead of window height.

config.backstageTasks, config.commands.syncing, config.macros.sync, config.syncers, config.tasks.sync, currSync

removed all objects, methods and state variables related to sync mechanism
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/57

TiddlyWiki.prototype.saveTiddler

TiddlySpace compatibility: add defaultCustomFields if no fields are defined, always set 'dirty' flag, even if not "file://"
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/65
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/14
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/13

config.macros.timeline.refresh

handle sort prefix on fieldname for <<timeline {+|-}fieldname ...>>
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/82

httpReq

in options.beforeSend(), do not add "X-Requested-With" data to HTTP request header
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/87

Story.prototype.forEachTiddler

only process elements with title="..." attributes (skip non-tiddler elements)
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/63

Story.prototype.loadMissingTiddler

preserve current 'dirty' flag when loading missing tiddlers
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/65
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/14
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/13

refreshPageTemplate, Story.prototype.switchTheme, TiddlyWiki.prototype.isAvailable

refactor local isAvailable() methods as a common store object method
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/85

JavaSaverStartup

moved to follow jsdeprecatedArea and before POST-SCRIPT insertion point
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/69
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/70

UnicodeFunctions

moved to separate "Filesystem Utilities" section following "Filesystem Code"
https://github.com/TiddlyWiki/tiddlywiki/issues/67

item.title: WhatsNew
item.description:
The following is a summary of notable user-level feature changes in TiddlyWiki v2.6.6 (alpha 1):
  • SystemSettings autosave
    Updates to the SystemSettings tiddler (i.e., when you change a persistent option checkbox or text input) will now trigger autosave handling if chkAutoSave is enabled.
  • Sync machine removed
    The backstage "sync" command and internal "sync machine" handling has been removed from the TiddlyWiki core code. Sync functionality will be migrated to an optional plugin in a future release (schedule to be determined).
  • Backstage "cloak" size
    The "backstage cloak" (shading applied to the document when the backstage is displayed) now matches document height instead of window height.
  • TiddlySpace: defaultCustomFields
    Saving a tiddler automatically adds "defaultCustomFields" (when no other fields are defined). This allows tiddlers that are created/modified by existing TiddlyWiki plugins to be properly saved to a remote TiddlySpace. Note: currently, defaultCustomFields are only being used with TiddlySpace, so this change will have no effect when saving tiddlers in a standard file-based (i.e. non-TiddlySpace) TiddlyWiki document.
  • Unsaved changes ('dirty' flag)
    Whenever a tiddler is changed, the document will always be marked as 'dirty' to indicate that there are pending unsaved changes. Previously, setting this flag was bypassed when viewing remotely-hosted documents (e.g., TiddlySpace).

item.title: HelloThere
item.description:
This is the ALPHA build of TiddlyWiki v2.6.6 (alpha 1), and incorporates all changes already committed to the TiddlyWiki source repository, including several enhancements to key functions and objects to increase stability, as well as an internal update to use jQuery v1.7.2 (previously releases used jQuery 1.6.4).

This version of TiddlyWiki "Classic" is the first to use TiddlyWiki5 to assemble and output the core system, rather than the old Ruby-based ginsu/cook utilities that were previously used. The ability of TiddlyWiki5 to directly create TiddlyWiki Classic documents ensures a robust and reliable future for the existing "installed base" of TiddlyWiki, even as the community migrates to using the new power and flexiblity of TiddlyWiki5.
